result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Austin V Phillip

defendant.name: Phillip, Austin V
defendant.address: 9010 N Port Washington Road,Bldg, Bayside, WI 53217

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Austin V Phillip appeared by video.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Austin V Phillip.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court due to the court being in receipt of a JusticePoint violation report. Court gave the defendant a STRONG verbal admonishment regarding the recent violations. Case adjourned to Branch 17 for a review hearing on November 28th, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Received and Filed. Phillip, Austin 10.31.22 Violation Report

Defendant Austin V Phillip in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Austin V Phillip.  Prosecuting attorney Brad Alan Vorpahl in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Review hearing held. Court holds colloquy with defendant regarding non-compliance issues. Court imposes and stays 1 day of sanction time. Defendant to complete intake assessments, attend all drug screens and provide usable samples, complete 8 hours of community service, and pay $100 towards restitution. Case adjourned, Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Received and Filed. DPA Court Report 10.20.22

Defendant Austin V Phillip in court.  Attorney Helmi Hamad in court for Austin V Phillip.  Prosecuting attorney David T. Malone in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant is not in compliance with the terms of the agreement as of today's court date. Defendant needs to complete the terms of the agreement in order to receive the benefits of the agreement. Defendant is to make a minimum payment of $100.00 by the next court date. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Received and Filed. DPA SUPERVISION REPORT 9-16-22
Received and Filed. Essay
Received and Filed. Letter of apology
Received and Filed. Behavior Contract
Received and Filed, Restitution Payment-Hamzah Harris Abdullah
No Contact with Best Buy.

As a condition of bail, court order the defendant may not possess dangerous weapons or firearms or apply for a conceal carry permit. 
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Parties are prepared to enter into a deferred prosecution agreement.

Defendant was advised of constitution rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights and entered a plea of GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the guilty plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Complaint/Information.  Court WITHHELD entry of judgment of conviction.  Deferred Prosecution Agreement received, signed and filed.
 
Court ordered case adjourned for Review Hearing. 
  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to branch 17, Judge Carolina Stark, in Room 310 of the Safety Building.

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial.  Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Defendant Austin V Phillip in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defense waived reading and momentarily enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of client.  Review hearing scheduled for September 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
NO CONTACT ORDER
Received and Filed, DPA Agreement
Received and Filed, Addendum to Plea form
Received and Filed, Elements
Received and Filed, Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Plea Advisement Form
Received and Filed, Prelim Waiver
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for review; NO CONTACT ORDER
